snp4.14:6.1: The commentary explains _majjhe_ “in the middle” firstly as between top and bottom layers, or alternatively as in-between the mountains (i.e. land masses). While it’s possible that there was a folk belief that the center of the ocean was waveless, surely a striking feature of the ocean is how the surface movement conceals a stillness beneath.
snp4.14:13.1: This is the only mention in the Pali EBTs of the texts later known as the Arthavaveda. Niddesa explains it as casting harmful spells.
snp4.14:13.3: PTS Dictionary suggests this should be read as the better-established _viruddhagabbhakaraṇaṁ_ ([dn1:1.26.2]()). If it is an error in the reading, it predates the Niddesa. Nonetheless, I translate _gabbhakaraṇa_ in a way that encompasses causing both pregnancy and abortion.
snp4.14:18.2: The MS reading seems unlikely to me, these are not usually paired. More likely it’s an example of the Aṭṭhakavagga idiom where _puthu_ refers to all the many different things said by ascetics.
